text: Early general elections were held in Montserrat on 20 September 1973.General Election Results - 20 September 1973 Caribbean Elections The result was a victory for the Progressive Democratic Party (PDP), which won five of the seven seats in the Legislative Council. PDP leader Percival Austin Bramble remained Chief Minister. ==Background== Following the 1970 elections, the next elections were not due until March 1976. However, Bramble asked the Governor to dissolve the Legislative Council on 7 August, resulting in early elections.J A George Irish (1974) Alliouagana in agony, p3 Bramble claimed that he required a new mandate to combat racism in the island's education system. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Progressive Democratic Party||2,279||65.2||5||–2 |- |align=left|Independents||1,214||34.8||2||+2 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||56||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total||3,549||100||7||0 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||5,051||70.3||–||– |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: EmmanuelPatrick A Emmanuel (1992) Elections & Party Systems in the Commonwealth Caribbean 1944-1991, Caribbean Development Research Service, pp10–24 |} ==References== 1973 Category:1973 elections in the Caribbean Category:1973 in Montserrat Category:September 1973 events in North America
title: 1973 Montserratian general election
